There exists infinitely many deficient numbers

type: {n | n.Deficient}.Infinite
name: Nat.infinite_deficient
docString: There exists infinitely many deficient numbers

Every natural number can be expressed as an even number (the sum of two identical numbers) or an odd number (2 times an integer plus 1).

type: ∀ (n : ℕ), Even n ∨ Odd n
name: Nat.even_or_odd
docString: Every natural number can be expressed as an even number (the sum of two identical numbers) or an odd number (2 times an integer plus 1).

This theorem states that for every natural number `n`, `n` is even if and only if `n` is not odd. Here, a number is defined as being even if it can be expressed as the sum of two identical numbers, and as being odd if it can be represented as `2*k + 1` for some natural number `k`. In other words, a natural number cannot be both even and odd simultaneously.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ}, Even n ↔ ¬Odd n
name: Nat.even_iff_not_odd
docString: This theorem states that for every natural number `n`, `n` is even if and only if `n` is not odd. Here, a number is defined as being even if it can be expressed as the sum of two identical numbers, and as being odd if it can be represented as `2*k + 1` for some natural number `k`. In other words, a natural number cannot be both even and odd simultaneously.

Any infinite set of naturals is denumerable.

type: (s : Set ℕ) → [inst : DecidablePred fun x => x ∈ s] → [inst : Infinite ↑s] → Denumerable ↑s
name: Nat.Subtype.denumerable
docString: Any infinite set of naturals is denumerable.

The set of prime natural numbers is infinite.

type: {p | p.Prime}.Infinite
name: Nat.infinite_setOf_prime
docString: The set of prime natural numbers is infinite.

This theorem, `Mathlib.Data.Int.Parity._auxLemma.19`, states that the integer 1 is not even. In the context of this theorem, a number is defined as even if it can be expressed as the sum of two identical numbers. However, there is no integer that, when doubled, equals 1, hence 1 is not considered even under this definition.

type: ∀ {α : Sort u_1} {a b : α}, (a = b) = (b = a)
name: Mathlib.Data.Int.Parity._auxLemma.19
docString: This theorem, `Mathlib.Data.Int.Parity._auxLemma.19`, states that the integer 1 is not even. In the context of this theorem, a number is defined as even if it can be expressed as the sum of two identical numbers. However, there is no integer that, when doubled, equals 1, hence 1 is not considered even under this definition.

The infinite monadic lazy list of natural numbers.

type: {m : Type → Type} → [inst : Monad m] → MLList m ℕ
name: MLList.range
docString: The infinite monadic lazy list of natural numbers.

A product of finite numbers is still finite.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_1} {s : Finset α} {f : α → ENNReal}, (∀ a ∈ s, f a < ⊤) → ∏ a ∈ s, f a < ⊤
name: ENNReal.prod_lt_top
docString: A product of finite numbers is still finite.

Infinitely many natural numbers are equal to `d` mod `n`.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ}, n ≠ 0 → ∀ (d : ℕ), ∃ᶠ (m : ℕ) in Filter.atTop, m ≡ d [MOD n]
name: Nat.frequently_modEq
docString: Infinitely many natural numbers are equal to `d` mod `n`.

Type of natural numbers with infinity (`⊤`)

type: Type
name: PartENat
docString: Type of natural numbers with infinity (`⊤`)

Any constant function is even.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_1} {β : Type u_2} [inst : Neg α] (b : β), Function.Even fun x => b
name: Function.Even.const
docString: Any constant function is even.

Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization

type: Set.InjOn Nat.factorization {x | x ≠ 0}
name: Nat.factorization_inj
docString: Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization

name: Nat.evenOddStrongRec

**Bertrand's Postulate**: For any positive natural number, there is a prime which is greater than
it, but no more than twice as large.

type: ∀ (n : ℕ), n ≠ 0 → ∃ p, Nat.Prime p ∧ n < p ∧ p ≤ 2 * n
name: Nat.exists_prime_lt_and_le_two_mul
docString:
**Bertrand's Postulate**: For any positive natural number, there is a prime which is greater than
it, but no more than twice as large.

There are finitely many embeddings of a number field.

type:
(K : Type u_1) →
  [inst : Field K] →
    [inst_1 : NumberField K] → (A : Type u_2) → [inst_2 : Field A] → [inst_3 : CharZero A] → Fintype (K →+* A)
name: NumberField.Embeddings.instFintypeRingHom
docString: There are finitely many embeddings of a number field.

There are finitely many subsets of a given finite set

type: ∀ {α : Type u} {a : Set α}, a.Finite → {b | b ⊆ a}.Finite
name: Set.Finite.finite_subsets
docString: There are finitely many subsets of a given finite set

The order of the `0` power series is infinite.

type: ∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R], PowerSeries.order 0 = ⊤
name: PowerSeries.order_zero
docString: The order of the `0` power series is infinite.

Euclid's theorem on the **infinitude of primes**.
Here given in the form: for every `n`, there exists a prime number `p ≥ n`.

type: ∀ (n : ℕ), ∃ p, n ≤ p ∧ Nat.Prime p
name: Nat.exists_infinite_primes
docString:
Euclid's theorem on the **infinitude of primes**.
Here given in the form: for every `n`, there exists a prime number `p ≥ n`.

The number of infinite real places of the number field `K`.

type: (K : Type u_2) → [inst : Field K] → [inst : NumberField K] → ℕ
name: NumberField.InfinitePlace.nrRealPlaces
docString: The number of infinite real places of the number field `K`.

A sum is infinite iff one term is infinite.

type:
∀ {ι : Type u_1} {α : Type u_2} [inst : AddCommMonoid α] {s : Finset ι} {f : ι → WithBot α},
  ∑ i ∈ s, f i = ⊥ ↔ ∃ i ∈ s, f i = ⊥
name: WithBot.sum_eq_bot_iff
docString: A sum is infinite iff one term is infinite.

A natural number is odd iff it has residue `1` or `3` mod `4`

name: Nat.odd_mod_four_iff
docString: A natural number is odd iff it has residue `1` or `3` mod `4`

In `Fin n`, all elements are even for odd `n`,
otherwise an element is even iff its `Fin.val` value is even.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ} {k : Fin n}, Even k ↔ Odd n ∨ Even ↑k
name: Fin.even_iff
docString:
In `Fin n`, all elements are even for odd `n`,
otherwise an element is even iff its `Fin.val` value is even.

An infinite encodable type is denumerable.

type: (α : Type u_3) → [inst : Encodable α] → [inst : Infinite α] → Denumerable α
name: Denumerable.ofEncodableOfInfinite
docString: An infinite encodable type is denumerable.

A sum is infinite iff one of the summands is infinite.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_1} {s : Finset α} {f : α → ENNReal}, ∑ x ∈ s, f x = ⊤ ↔ ∃ a ∈ s, f a = ⊤
name: ENNReal.sum_eq_top
docString: A sum is infinite iff one of the summands is infinite.
